chatMessages.name: Mrs. Smith
chatMessages.message: Good morning class! Today we'll be covering Newton's Laws of Motion. Is everyone ready to begin?

chatMessages.name: Alex
chatMessages.message: Yes, ready to learn about Newton's Laws!

chatMessages.name: Mrs. Smith
chatMessages.message: Great! Let's start with the First Law - An object at rest stays at rest, and an object in motion stays in motion, unless acted upon by an external force.

chatMessages.name: Emily
chatMessages.message: So is that why we need seatbelts in cars? Because our body wants to keep moving forward when the car stops?

chatMessages.name: Mrs. Smith
chatMessages.message: Excellent observation, Emily! That's exactly right. This is a perfect real-world application of Newton's First Law.

studentDoubts.question: Can you explain the difference between mass and weight again?
Why does friction always oppose motion? And does it always act in the opposite direction?
In the equation F=ma, if we double the force, does that mean acceleration doubles too?
Could you give more examples of action-reaction pairs in everyday life?
